result.execSummary:
The defendant Creston A. Ballman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
consecutive with zero credit.  The defendant is currently in prison.  Pre-Sentence Investigation waived.
March 27, 2015:  Amended JOC issued.  The defendant IS eligible for the  Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If sentence is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules and conditions of supervision.  Notify department of any change of address or employer.  Comply with Sex Offender Registry Program under 301.45, Wis. Stats.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
